functions.name: concat
functions.description: concatenate a set of string

functions.name: equals
functions.description: check if two strings are equal

functions.name: equalsIgnoreCase
functions.description: check if two strings are equal ignoring case

functions.name: contains
functions.description: check if str2 is within str1

functions.name: float
functions.description: convert the string to a float

functions.name: integer
functions.description: convert the string to an integer

functions.name: len
functions.description: get the length of a string

functions.name: substring
functions.description: get a substring from a string

functions.name: matchregex
functions.description: Match input against regular expression   utils.matchregex("p([a-z]+)ch", "peach")

functions.name: replaceregex
functions.description: Replace data in a string based on a regular expression match   utils.replaceregex("p([a-z]+)ches", " I hate peaches !", "apples")

functions.name: containsany
functions.description: ContainsAny reports whether any Unicode code points in chars are within s.   utils.containsany("failure", "u & i")

functions.name: count
functions.description: Count counts the number of non-overlapping instances of substr in s. If substr is an empty string, Count returns 1 + the number of Unicode code points in s. utils.count("cheese", "e")

functions.name: index
functions.description: Index returns the index of the first instance of substr in s, or -1 if substr is not present in s. utils.index("cheese", "e")

functions.name: indexany
functions.description: IndexAny returns the index of the first instance of any Unicode code point from chars in s, or -1 if no Unicode code point from chars is present in s. utils.indexany("chicken", "aeiouy")

functions.name: lastindex
functions.description: LastIndex returns the index of the last instance of substr in s, or -1 if substr is not present in s. utils.lastindex("go gopher", "go")

functions.name: repeat
functions.description: Repeat returns a new string consisting of count copies of the string s. utils.repeat("na", 3)

functions.name: replace
functions.description: Replace returns a copy of the string s with the first n non-overlapping instances of old replaced by new.  If n < 0, there is no limit on the number of replacements  utils.replace("oink oink oink", "k", "ky", 2)

functions.name: replaceall
functions.description: ReplaceAll returns a copy of the string s with all non-overlapping instances of old replaced by new.  utils.replaceall("oink oink oink", "oink", "moo")

functions.name: tolower
functions.description: ToLower returns a copy of the string s with all Unicode letters mapped to their lower case.  utils.tolower("Hello World")

functions.name: toupper
functions.description: ToUpper returns a copy of the string s with all Unicode letters mapped to their upper case.  utils.toupper("Hello World")

functions.name: trim
functions.description: Trim returns a slice of the string s with all leading and trailing Unicode code points contained in cutset removed. utils.trim("¡¡¡Hello, Gophers!!!", "!¡")

functions.name: trimleft
functions.description: TrimLeft returns a slice of the string s with all leading Unicode code points contained in cutset removed. utils.trimleft("¡¡¡Hello, Gophers!!!", "!¡")

functions.name: trimright
functions.description: TrimRight returns a slice of the string s with all trailing Unicode code points contained in cutset removed. utils.trimright("¡¡¡Hello, Gophers!!!", "!¡")

functions.name: trimprefix
functions.description: TrimPrefix returns s without the provided leading prefix string. If s doesn't start with prefix, s is returned unchanged. utils.trimprefix("¡¡¡Hello, Gophers!!!", "¡¡¡Hello")

functions.name: trimsuffix
functions.description: TrimSuffix returns s without the provided trailing suffix string. If s doesn't end with suffix, s is returned unchanged. utils.trimsuffix("¡¡¡Hello, Gophers!!!", "Gophers!!!")

functions.name: split
functions.description: Split slices s into all substrings separated by sep and returns a slice of the substrings between those separators. utils.split("a,b,c", ",")
